passages.text: Specialist Sales APAC Specialist Sales 28 August 2025
3 key highlights today:

- SOMPO HOLDINGS (8630 JP, N): Aspen Insurance acquisition, ROE and EPS growth accretive acquisition at the right price- FUTU HOLDINGS (Futu US, OW): Katherine/Peter raises PT again, HK\$270 on re-rating to PER 28x- CHINA LIFE (2628 HK, OW): 1H NP met bears' expectations, Interim dividend hike was a nice positive surprise

BankInsuranceDiversifiedMacro28-AugThuHuaxia Bank, Bank of Nanjing, Industrial Bank, Bank of Shanghai, Bank of Ningbo, PBK, Hua NanCPIC, New China Life, China Taiping, MedibankCITIC Securities, China Merchants Securities, PerpetualBOK, BSP, Bitcoin Asia Conference in HK US 2Q GDP29-AugFriICBC, ABC, CCB, BOC, BoComm, PSBC, CMB, BOCHK, China Minsheng, China Everbright, Bank of Beijing, Mega FinancialChina ReHuatai, GF, Galaxy, GTJA, CICCTokyo CPI, India 2Q GDP, US PCE
Use the links below to jump straight to each section: Detailed Highlight Sector Key Newsflow Full Research Links
SOMPO HOLDINGS (8630 JP, N): Aspen Insurance acquisition, ROE and EPS growth accretive acquisition at the right price (Koki Sato: Link)

- Official announcement of Aspen Insurance (AHL US), Koki Sato assesses the acquisition price was fair The acquisition of price of \(37.5 / \text{share}\), which is \(3.5bn\) (Y520bn) looks fair. (11-12x considering adjusted profit contribution of Y45bn+ in FY3/27, 1.32x tangible net asset, 35.6% premium to Aug 19 share price before the Insurance Insider report.)

- ROE accretive (div hike potential) > Near-term ESR impact (buyback) as long as it's an acquisition at the right price? While this Y520bn acquisition would lower ESR by 30ppt (end-June 264.8% vs target 200-250%, but they have minimum Y83bn buyback capacity w/out excess ESR), it would would meaningfully improve Sompo's growth profile, which has lowest ROE among Japanese P&C (lift ROE by 1pt, a step closer to MTP 13-15%, lift MTP EPS CAGR from +12% to +18%) by becoming global top 10 reinsurer. Sompo hasn't sold Palantir shares yet.
- Feedback: As Sompo's major acquisition ambition was well known, the question was on the valuation esp given Japanese

insurers historically tend to overpay. In that context, investors at least seem to view the deal as fair. While ROE accretive acquisition is positive, questions on their decision of buying Financial line in the US which is softening etc. Briefing 13:00 JST today (Somno's presentation on the deal: Link)
Strategic Impact on SOMPO's Mid-term Management Plan
1 Normalized earnings basis, estimates for FY2021 and FY2022 2 Impact ex. the loss of investment income associated with the acquisition funding : Approx. +1.4pt
FUTU HOLDINGS (Futu US, OW): Katherine/Peter raises PT again, \(\) 270\(on re - rating to PER 28x (Katherine Lei/Peter Zhang: Link)

Futu's valuation discount to peers is set to narrow (Futu has the highest ROE and EPS growth outlook among online peers, yet the lowest PER) Regulatory tightening in 4Q21 (restricted onboarding new Mainland clients) led to deceleration in client AUM CAGR (9% in 2022- 2023 vs 100% in 2019- 2021) therefore de- rating (14x vs 35x). Futu FY26e PER 19x (vs Hood 49x, IBKR 28x, East Money 32x), ROE 25% (vs Hood 18.5%, IBKR 23.5%, East Money 13%) Acceleration in Futu's key operating metrics is sustainable, supporting re- rating Futu's paying client, client AUM, revenues and earnings grew at 27%/28%/30%/34% CAGR from 2021 to 1H25. (Table 2 below) While the level is lower vs 2019- 2021, it's been much stronger than the initial expectation of low teens supported by 1) overseas expansion, 2) wealth management, 3) higher wallet share from HNW clients, 4) strong market sentiment in China/HK. Feedback: Sell- side analysts keep raising PT as share price keeps going up, but it may be the cheapest cyrpto stock in the world.
Table 2: Futu's key operating metrics have accelerated since 2024, which should help to support Futu's re-rating

2019-21 CAGR2022-23 CAGR2024-1H25 CAGRFutu paying clients111%17%41%Futu clients AUM (HK$ bn)100%9%59%Futu revenues (HK$ mn)106%19%47%Futu earnings (HK$ mn)324%23%51%Peak FY1 PE92.720.925.1Mean FY1 PE34.614.114.1
Source: Company data. Bloomberg Finance L.P.
Source: Bloomberg Finance L.P.
CHINA LIFE (2628 HK, OW): 1H NP met bears' expectations, Interim dividend hike was a nice positive surprise (MW Kim's note is out: Link)

- NP \(+7\%\) YoY met bear expectation of mid-single digit, Interim dividend hike was positive Dividend hikes from Chinese insurers across the board during this earnings season (PICC and PICC P&C also hiked yesterday) would increase investors' confidence in a regular interim dividend payment. While core capital ratio declined QoQ to \(139.5\%\) (inline w/ JPMc 140%, 1Q 146%), MW is not concerned as this the co has yet to fully mark-to-market its asset valuation change. (Presentation: Link) 
- Feedback: During our sales-driven "APAC Conviction Call" campaign on China Life-H this Tue showed LOs showing constructive views on the sector due to this new interim dividend paying behavior and potential reforms in the upcoming five-year plan, with a preference for beta plays but with quality. HFs seem to have been more cautious on momentum and valuation ahead of earnings.

- NAB Names Inder Singh As Group CFO (Bloomberg)- QBE Insurance Says CFO Inder Singh Tendered Resignation (Bloomberg)- Aspen Insurance Up on Report Sompo to Buy Firm for ¥500b (Bloomberg)- Japan's Sompo to Buy Aspen Insurance in \(3.5 Billion Deal (Bloomberg)- Super-Long Japan Bonds Lure\)63 Billion Korean Financial Firm (Bloomberg)- Metaplanet to Raise 130.3b Yen in Overseas Share Issuance (Bloomberg)- Former PBOC Chief Zhou Pushes Back Against China Stablecoin Idea (Bloomberg)

- Sompo Holdings (8630) Announces agreement to begin procedures to acquire Aspen Insurance Holdings - Koki Sato (Link)- China Life Insurance - H First Take: Strong interim DPS hike in 1H25 (Rmb0.238, 19% oya) with positive profit growth - MW Kim (Link)- PICC Group - H First Take: Interim dividend hike (Rmb0.075, 19% oya) welcome, but PICC Life profit declined - MW Kim (Link)- PICC Property and Casualty (2328) First Take: High quality beat in 1H25 - MW Kim (Link)- Futu Holdings Assessing upside on multiple re-rating - Katherine Lei, Peter Zhang (Link)- Shanghai Pudong Development Bank - A First Take: 2Q25 a beat with improving NIM and asset quality - Katherine Lei (Link)- China Citic Bank - H 2Q25 in line with recovering trend in revenue and PPoP - Katherine Lei (Link)

Some of the events referenced above will only be available to and can only be attended by High Touch clients who have subscribed to certain J.P. Morgan research packages. If you consider the facilitation component of any of these events to be a non- monetary benefit, please contact your normal J.P. Morgan sales advisor to discuss making a payment for this service which is unbundled from any research payment. The event is intended for J.P. Morgan clients only.

Futu's PE multiple derated from 20x-90x in the 2020-21 period to 10x-20x during the 2022-1H25 period
